alert.note: Alert for Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 15 at 8:41AM EST until December 17 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure across the Mid Atlantic will move north and east into southern New England tonight and on Friday...with the season`s first widespread winter storm expected to continue across the area through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations up to 6 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine. Portions of central and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From this evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Significant snowfall and periods of heavy snowfall rates will combine with low visibility to create very dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with rain at times Friday morning before changing to rain Friday. Greatest accumulation is expected further from the coast and at higher elevations.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
